title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Energy Minister Angus Taylor says the government will "overachieve significantly” emission reduction targets laid out by the Kyoto 2020 agreement. Mr Taylor’s comments follow Labor frontbencher Joel Fitzgibbon’s recommendations that he put forward on Wednesday, in which his party slash its emission reduction target of 45 per cent by 2030 to the Coalition’s goal of 28 per cent. The energy minister told Sky News the government has a “strong target and a clear plan” to reduce emissions, citing a $3.5 billion “climate solutions package". “These are sensible targets that are balanced,” Mr Taylor said. Image: News Corp Australia
